reviews.text: When we were planning this summer's trip to Austria, England and Scotland, my two traveling companions and I were struck by the large number of favorable comments about Croft, which we actually found on Tingo, TA's partner reservations service. We wanted to find a decent place that would allow us to explore WIndermere and Keswick, as well as giving us a brief perspective of much of the Lake District.
reviews.title: This charming B&B deserves its very high TripAdvisor rating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accordingly, we booked two rooms here, unfortunately only for one night, because it is truly SUPERB! I cannot begin to describe all of the details of the rooms; suffice it to say that a large variety of teas, coffee and hot chocolate are offered in each room, even with a small rectangular plate marked "Tea Bags!" The building has very modern bath fittings and blissfully comfortable beds, but the renovation has been done in a careful way - I noticed that my top-floor single room had an original support beam over the exterior window, that had been dovetailed into the new plaster work of the renovation.
reviews.title: Definitely worth stopping here

reviews.text: The owners, Eddie and Barbara, provided a full English breakfast; Eddie even, on our request, prepared some superb organic porridge to accompany the rest of the food. Even the bread was home-made that morning.
reviews.title: Everything we could have wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of the best B&Bs I have ever visited; I would give it SIX if that were possible!
reviews.title: A fantastic B&B

reviews.text: Our stay at The Croft House was very last minute and was recommended to us by a nice lady in the Tourist Information . It is very central to the town centre, bars and restaurants all on the doorstep. The other great advantage was the onsite parking.
reviews.title: The best B&B we stayed at in Britain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a two night stay with my husband. We stayed here to attend a wedding at Hundith Hall. We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. Really affordable, comfortable and clean. The breakfasts were lovely, with plenty of choice. There was the usual full english, homemade granola and other cereals as well as 'specials' such as smoked salmon and scrambled eggs. Nothing was too much trouble, and the owners bent over backwards to accomodate any requests.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, food and hospitality!

reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The beds had crisp white linen, feather duvets and pillows and fluffy white towels were provided in the bathroom. The B+B had plenty of little extras such as bathroom toiletries, hairdryer, corkscrew,even a sewing kit. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided and topped up when needed. There was even a little pot of sweets. Each room had an en suite bathroom, with a clean shower and loo.
reviews.title: Excellent stay! Very clean and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right at the heart of Cockermouth, this is ideally located for visitors to the area, with plenty of shops, pubs and restaurants close by. Absolutely loved staying here, and can't recommend it enough. xx
reviews.title: Best Guest House ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two rooms at Croft House in May 2013 while on a two week trip around Great Britain. One was a single room, the other had two single beds. Both rooms were located on the top floor. A few staircases to climb but not bad. Very nice and super clean! A hair dryer and tea/coffee were located in the room. It is very nicely decorated throughout the entire hotel. The owner was very friendly upon our arrival, gave great recommendations for dinner and local sites, and cooked a great breakfast! The parking was a bit small but we managed to snag a spot overnight, and I believe a public car park is located nearby. So far this was the best place we have stayed on our trip and I would highly recommend it to anyone. No complaints whatsoever.
reviews.title: Friendliest place we ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and myself spent 2 nights here. We wanted to give a bad review so that when we want to go back we would find availability but felt perhaps we had to tell the truth!
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: I cannot rate my 3-night stay highly enough. Great value, great attention at booking, tolerant and flexible with my partially unconfirmed arrangements, fabulous breakfast (definitely not same as, same as here), beautiful room with tasteful modern furnishings, free internet, quiet location albeit in town and for me a mark of real attention to detail; I bought myself a bottle of wine to drink in the room whilst I worked in the evening and used the bedroom's normal chunky water glass, but when I arrived back from my work the next day - a lovely wine glass was there in the room instead. They noticed! I am impressed and the only sadness is that I was there on business and there won't be too many chances to visit this oasis. Eddie and Barbara, take a bow, you do a great job.
reviews.title: April/May 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am probably going to be repeating what everybody else has said in praise of this wonderful place. Lovely rooms, welcoming hosts and the parking is a real bonus as the public car parks with Cockermouth's one way system can be a little complicated to reach. We found Cockermouth absolutely delightful with lots to see and do and some really different shops. The town seems to have used the awful floods to revitalise itself as it now looks wonderful although local people have terrible stories to tell about their experiences when the rivers ran through the town. Very handy to be able to walk to the Jennings Brewery tour especially as you taste a pint and a half of pretty strong beer. We enjoyed eating at the Bitter End and Tarantella which does an excellent early bird meal. The walk around Buttermere is delightful and fairly flat with beautiful views all the way round. Would like to have stayed there longer and I am really sure we shall go back. Lots of fruit at breakfast, home made bread and breakfast specials, in addition to the full english, including kippers and smoked haddock while we were there. We didn't want anything else to eat until the evening!
reviews.title: Amazing Breakfast

reviews.text: Very impressed with our stay. We would most definately stay here again. It was value for money, very clean, very spacious and the breakfast was great! I would recommend to anyone. Also the staff were friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Overall, great! Clean, spacious and a lovely atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for just one night as we were doing the Jenning's brewery tour - but wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: No wonder it's number one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in the town centre with parking (a real bonus!) and a warm welcome from Eddie gave a good first impression. Lovely room - spotlessly clean - and all the facilities you'd expect in a top hotel. The breakfast was huge and freshly cooked - with local ingredients.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice clear website that told us everything we needed to know. Good prices and comfortable accommodation. A great place for our overnight stay away from family and kids for \valentines. Nice choice for breakfast and good sized portions available. Quiet sidestreet so no traffic noise. Eddie and babs made our night away from home very enjoyable. Recommended for couples
reviews.title: Croft Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed over the Easter period. Ian and Helen made us very welcome after parking the car in the guest houses car park ( a real bonus) showed us to our lovely room. This is as good as B @ B's get with exceptional breakfasts and brilliant friendly service. We will be back.
reviews.title: couldn't be faulted

reviews.text: Dave and Lyn
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay!
Excellent
reviews.text: Amazing breakfasts, lovely room and comfy bed! Our son absolutely loved it and the family room was a good size for us all. The bathroom was slightly cold but we did go at the coldest time of the year. Thank you for a great stay!

A lovely welcome and a smashing room. A very comfortable night followed by super breakfast in the morning. All in all great value and very central to the town but in a quiet area. Parking available which is always a bonus in a town centre and overall cannot praise the Croft highly enough for service, cleanliness and customer care. On our list of gems to stay at again.
reviews.title: The best b&b in cockermouth
